---
title: "Anfet"
subtitle: "Lessons for better direction in life, work, and relationships"
---

> **Anfet** (Tigrinya) means **Direction** — the kind you wish someone had handed you before you learned the hard way.

እዚ መጽሓፍ እዚ ተግባራዊ ካርታ እዩ፡ ህይወት ንምምራሕ ዝቐልል ትምህርታት፣ ኣእምራውያን ሞዴላት፣ ከምኡ'ውን ልምድታት።ህይወት ቀሊል ስለዝኾነ ዘይኮነስ፣ ግን ነቲ መሬት ቅድሚ ግዜ ስለትርእዮ እዩ — ነቲ ትሕዝትኡ ዘለዎም፣ ነቶም ሕባእቲ ሕግታት፣ ነቶም ምትሕውዋሳት፣ ከምኡ'ውን ነቶም ዝውህሉ ስጉምትታት።

## እዚ ንመን እዩ
- ንመምህራን፣ ኔትወርክ፣ ወይ "ውሽጣዊ" ሓበሬታ ዘይረኸቡ መንእሰያትን ተማሃሮን
- ካብ መጀመርያ ዝጅምር፣ አንፈት ዝቕይር፣ ወይ ብውሑድ ጣዕሳ ብቕልጡፍ ክዓቢ ዝፍትን ዝኾነ ሰብ
- ዓለም ከመይ ከም እትሰርሕ - ኣብ ገዛ፣ ኣብ ስራሕ፣ ከምኡ'ውን ኣብ ሕብረተሰብ - ዝያዳ ንጹር ሞዴል ክረኽቡ ዝደልዩ ዘማላለሱ ሰባት

## How this book is organized
- The parts move from **self** → **skills** → **work** → **money** → **relationships** → **society** → **the long game**.
- Each chapter is built to be skimmable and useful. You’ll usually find:
  - **Aha moments** — the insight that changed how I see things
  - **Failure lessons** — what cost me time, confidence, or opportunity
  - **Rules of the game** — written and unwritten rules (incentives, status, power, norms)
  - **Exercises** — small actions you can do this week
  - **Stories** — examples from real life (including mine) to make it concrete

## How to read it
- Read it like a **toolkit**, not a textbook.
- Start with the chapter that matches your current problem.
- Keep one note titled **“Anfet — Lessons”** and write:
  - what surprised you
  - what you will do differently
  - what you’ll test this week

## A small promise
If you apply even a few ideas here consistently, you’ll gain two things:
1. **Better direction** — fewer wasted loops  
2. **More leverage** — small actions that compound over time
